channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Unclear road markings, 7th September
item.description:
All along the recently resurfaced Pittville Road there is heavy vegetation litter as well as grass and other smaller plants taking root. Many double yellow line markings are unclear as well as small drainage issues. As the road was only resurfaced 1 year ago it would be great if the relevant department could do regular cleans to keep it looking new for as long as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15-27, Pittville Circus Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Impassable footpath, 7th September
item.description:
After moderate rain surface water is present under the bridge on Market St. This is not only an obstruction to cyclists, but also makes the path unusable for pedestrians and wheel chair users whereby they may have to walk in the run facing oncoming traffic.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Street, St Paul’s, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavements in General, 7th September
item.description:
All round the close- pavements and road in poor condition. Could do with patching & being on a planned repair list
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cousley Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Corner of Green Lane/Billbrook Rd, 7th September
item.description:
Consistently having vehicles park right on the corner of the junction. Had a very near miss as traffic on Billbrook cannot see out to Green Lane & when turning into Billbrook from Green Lane, you can’t see cars coming from Billbrook. This is getting worse and worse and it will only be a matter of time before there is a serious accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Billbrook Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: B4063 Hare and Hounds -Traffic light sequence causing huge traffic delays, 6th September
item.description:
Traffic lights at Hare and Hounds on B4063 now 4 way and causing chaos. Cars coming from Elmbridge Court Roundabout are queuing from the roundabout in rush hour, all the way to the H&H lights as the sequence of lights limits how many cars can through on green. Please can a review of these lights take place. They used to be 2 way. Today it was noted the traffic was jamming on the Elmbridge Court Roundabout causing chaos to cars trying to enter the roundabout to get onto B4063.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Please paint a cycle box by the traffic lights, 6th September
item.description:
Outside 2 Cirencester Road Cars often block access to our driveway causing tailbacks as they do not respect the correct white line. I believe a cycle box would solve this issue and encourage more cycling in town.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Cirencester Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Blocked drain in Alexandra Street, 6th September
item.description:
This drain (outside number 25 Alexandra St) is full of compacted vegetation which is impeding rain water from draining properly leading to overflow.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Alexandra Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Rubbish bin needed, 6th September
item.description:
May I suggest a rubbish bin here, at the end of footpath. Perhaps it will encourage people not to drop their rubbish along footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Finlay Way, Tewkesbury

item.title: The lights are too dim in a rough area, 6th September
item.description:
The houses down brook road heading towards flats is a dodgy place to be walking day or night but the lighting needs to be bright so you are able to see down the road on who may be walking up the road, contact police for reports of what’s taken place in those flats and then you will know it’s justified
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights heading out of Cheltenham not detecting vehicles, 6th September
item.description:
The sign for ‘wait here’ is too far away from the temporary traffic light causing the lights not to change and a dangerous back up of traffic. The sign needs to be moved next to the traffic light as it is on the opposite side, currently the light heading towards Cheltenham gets priority causing dangerous overtakes and almost grid lock traffic throughout the day!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 251, London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Sunken area has been surrounded by ugly Glos Highways barriers -, 5th September
item.description:
Please confirm WHAT Glos Highways are actually doing to RESOLVE this issue which I reported 3 YEARS ago. Stop prevaricating and do something positive please. Orange barriers is NOT a proper solution Do I need to lodge an ombudsman's complaint to get action - if so, kindly let me know and I certainly will? Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Ivy Bank, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Road narrows temporary traffic sign left on the verge, 5th September
item.description:
Just before the cemetery entrance on the grass verge in Bouncer's Lane a triangular 'road narrows' temporary warning sign has been left behind by a road contractor. Please remove
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18;19, Burma Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham
